reasoning: Extremely rare pediatric malignancy with estimated incidence ~0.05 per 100k person-years (approximately 0.5-2 per million births globally). Most commonly presents as renal rhabdoid tumor or atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor (AT/RT) of CNS in children under 5 years. Estimate based on aggregation of pediatric oncology case series and SEER registry reports showing <100 annual diagnoses in US. Limited epidemiological studies available; confidence reduced due to sparse 2005-specific data.
